title: Powertrain Performance Engineer– Electric Propulsion System Experimental Validation Specialist
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than  800 people who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. Your Role and your Team:
We are looking for an outstanding performance engineer to join our innovative team that will shape the future of urban e-mobility.
You will report to the Propulsion Thermal & Performance Team Leader and will contribute, as part of the propulsion integrated cross-functional team, to the development, certification and delivery of the Lilium Jet. In particular, you will focus on supporting the verification test campaign for the performance of the propulsion system or sub-systems.
Your Day to Day:

Define and support system validation activities including certification (EASA SC E19 subpartD)
Close cooperation with the test engineers responsible for the different propulsion test rigs
support propulsion unit or engine test preparation and commissioning activities
drive day to day decisions to ensure quick execution of tests and on-time delivery of results
derivation of datasets for a given test configuration: model development, derivation of operating points and timely release of required data for the different teams
Provide detailed reports for certification purposes.
Close cooperation with the modelling and simulation engineer in charge of the performance model
Close cooperation with the engineers developing the electrical machine, power electronics and control systems.

Your Profile:

or Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Electrical Engineering required
3-5 years experience as performance engineer involved in test campaigns for R&D, validation and verification, ideally on electrical machines or electrical powertrain
Able to coordinate tasks and interface with complex multidisciplinary team to deliver project (production, test engineers, specialists)
Strong problem solving and decision making skills including past experience in root-cause analysis activities
Experience with Matlab/Simulink required.
High level of self-reliance with the ability to work in a team, as well as autonomous
Dynamic and positive personality
Fluent English language skills are essential.

 
#LI-K1Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

questions.description:
Lilium Website Privacy Notice

Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice

** For clarity, to comply with our legal obligations, Lilium will collect, store, and process your data for 6 months for the purpose of considering you for employment.  Additionally, should you provide consent directly below, Lilium will also collect, store, and process your data for up to 730 days thereafter for the purpose of considering you for other opportunities on the Lilium Career Portal.
questions.label: Data Protection Information

values.label: I confirm that I have read and understood the Lilium Website Privacy Notice and the Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice, regarding the collection, processing and storage of my personal data for the recruitment process.

questions.label: IMPORTANT: I confirm I have submitted my CV in English, and understand that my application will not be reviewed if it is in another language
